title: 112_hr2867
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2011." It establishes that each member of the Commission shall serve a 2-year term and may not serve more than 2 terms. The Act establishes term limits for members of the Commission, stating that a member's term expires 90 days after the end date. Members attending less than 75% of meetings during a term are ineligible for reappointment. Additionally, no member can serve as Chair for consecutive terms. Members of the Commission are subject to federal travel regulations and Department of State regulations. Additionally, antidiscrimination laws are applied under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The Commission's employees are treated as employees of the Senate or House for the application of antidiscrimination laws related to various employment protections. The Act authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2012 through 2014 and amends standards of conduct and disclosure under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The Act amends the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998, changing the termination date to September 30, 2014. A report on the effectiveness of US programs promoting international religious freedom is required within a year of the Act's enactment. Government programs promoting international religious freedom, assessing the roles of the Office on International Religious Freedom, the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom, and the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom. The Freedom Act of 1998 (22 U.S.C. 6431(a)) requires a comparative analysis of the structure of the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom and its relationship with the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom. Possible reforms to improve their ability to reach goals and objectives are also to be reviewed. The term "appropriate congressional committees" is defined in section 3 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 (22 U.S.C. 6402). The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
